Others: The Oklahoma City Thunder made quick work of the Houston Rockets with a 126-107 win.
The Thunder jumped out to a 75-51 lead by the end of the first half.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Chet Holmgren combined for 58 points on the night.
Oklahoma City shot 51% from the field and nearly 38% from 3-point range.
The Thunder remains at the top of the NBA defensive rating ladder with a 97.3 rating.
Holmgren's shot-blocking prowess and Williams' high league-leading steal numbers have caused nightmares for opposing defenses.
Oklahoma City will face the No. 3-seeded Golden State Warriors and the No. 1-seeded Phoenix Suns in its next two games.
